<Text: The Far West region of New South Wales, Australia refers generally to a fairly flat and low-lying area in the western part of the state, which is too dry to support wheat or other crops or intensive pastoral endeavours.>
Triplets:<The Far West
1:
--------------------
Text: Far West (New South Wales):  It is west of the North West Slopes, Central West and the Riverina.
Triplets:<Far West
2:
--------------------
Text: Far West (New South Wales):  It is an area with limited rainfall, and the only major rivers found in it are the Darling River and the Murray River (on its southern edge), which originate in the Great Dividing Range to the east.
Triplets:<Far West

Text: Far West (New South Wales):  It also corresponds to the Western Division established under the New South Wales "Western Lands Act 1901".
